statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: You are given a sequence of n numbers a<sub>0</sub>,..., a<sub>n-1</sub>. A cyclic shift by k positions (0<=k<=n-1) results in the following sequence: a<sub>k</sub> a<sub>k+1</sub>,..., a<sub>n-1</sub>, a<sub>0</sub>, a<sub>1</sub>,..., a<sub>k-1</sub>. How many of the n cyclic shifts satisfy the condition that the sum of the fi rst i numbers is greater than or equal to zero for all i with 1<=i<=n?

statement.title: Input
statement.content: Each test case consists of two lines. The fi rst contains the number n (1<=n<=10<sup>6</sup>), the number of integers in the sequence. The second contains n integers a<sub>0</sub>,..., a<sub>n-1</sub> (-1000<=a<sub>i</sub><=1000) representing the sequence of numbers. The input will  finish with a line containing 0.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, print one line with the number of cyclic shifts of the given sequence which satisfy the condition stated above.
